Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Montgomery(S&U) -- 1% S&U - Town Council - 5 yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Montgomery Sales and Use Tax Proposition

Summary:  A sales and use tax of one percent (1%) enacted pursuant to Louisiana Revised Statute 47:337.1, et seq. of the uniform local sales tax code.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Montgomery, Parish of Grant, State of Louisiana, levy a sales and use tax of one percent (1%) on the sale and use of all items sold within the municipality with said tax to begin January 1, 2010 following the special election on Saturday, October 17, 2009 and continuing for a term of five (5) consecutive years with the option of renewal for an additional five (5) year term by adopted Ordinance of the Town council and election in accordance with the Home Rule Charter, to be used in all areas of town business including, but not limited to, maintenance, upkeep and police and fire protection?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Montgomery (W/D) -- Wet/Dry - Town Council
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Montgomery Proposition

Summary:  To authorize the sale of beverages of low alcoholic content on Sunday within the limits of the Town of Montgomery, Louisiana.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Town of Montgomery, State of Louisiana, amend Ordinance No. 2 of 1995, which ordinance amended Ordinance 25-A of 1976, to provide as follows?

Section 17.1.2: Closing Hours:  Except for Easter and Christmas Day (when it falls on a Sunday), retail dealers may sell beverages of low alcoholic content (not more than six percent (6%) by volume) within the limits of the Town of Montgomery, Louisiana, between the hours of 12:00 p.m. on Sunday afternoon and continuing until 11:59 p.m. on Sunday evening.  These Sunday hours shall be in addition to those hours of sale already authorized by Ordinance No. 2 of 1995, which ordinance amended Ordinance 25-A of 1976.  
Section 17.1.3:  All portions of any Ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed.  Section 17.2.1:  Should any provision of this Ordinance, or the application thereof, be held invalid, such invalidity shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this Ordinance. 
Section 17.3.1:  This Ordinance shall become effective on the 1st day of December, 2009. 
Section 17.4.1:  "Retail dealer" shall include such dealer's servants, agents, and employees. 
Section 17.5.1:  In addition to its other preexisting definitions in the Ordinance, "sell" shall mean to "sell, offer to sell, dispense, or give away."
